column2: The café clock showed ten forty.
We stepped back onto the pavement.
A siren echoed in the distance.
Old stones pressed beneath my shoes.
A tour guide led a group nearby.
Dates and facts filled her speech.
We turned down a narrower road.
It was lined with small shops.
A bell chimed as we entered.
I picked up a brass clock.
Prices were written on tiny labels.
I set the clock down carefully.
We decided to walk to the river.
I replied with a simple yes.
We headed toward the office block.
The lobby was wide and echoing.
We pressed the button for floor nine.
A long table filled the centre.
The ground floor greeted us again.
I handed him a crisp note.
Tickets were scanned at the gate.
We moved to the next room.
One piece stood six feet tall.
We moved slowly through the hall.
